title: Cloud Types Quiz
description: Identify cloud types and weather associations

questions.question: Which type of cloud is tall, towering, and associated with thunderstorms, heavy rain, and sometimes hail?
Which thin, wispy clouds form at very high altitudes and are made almost entirely of ice crystals?
Which type of cloud forms a low, gray, uniform layer that often covers the entire sky and may produce light drizzle?
What are the white, fluffy, flat-bottomed clouds that appear on fair-weather days often called?
Which cloud type forms a thick, dark layer that brings continuous rain or snow for extended periods?
What does the prefix 'cirro-' indicate about a cloud's altitude?
Which mid-level clouds appear as gray or white patches or layers, often in rounded masses or rolls?
Which type of cloud can produce a halo around the sun or moon and forms a thin, whitish veil at high altitudes?
What is fog technically classified as?
options: A cumulus cloud at ground level
A stratus cloud at ground level
A nimbus cloud at ground level

questions.question: Which rare, lens-shaped clouds form near mountains and are sometimes mistaken for UFOs?
What does the Latin root 'nimbus' in a cloud name indicate?
Which clouds appear as small, white, high-altitude patches in rows and are sometimes called a 'mackerel sky'?
Which low-level clouds appear as a layer of rounded masses or rolls and are the most common cloud type worldwide?
Which dramatic pouch-like cloud formations hang from the underside of a cloud base and often signal severe weather?
At what approximate altitude range do mid-level 'alto' clouds typically form?
